intro: Rogersonanthus arboreus, commonly known as the tree hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Rogersonanthus arboreus thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental species in horticulture.
